content.description: Sit-down-start just to the left of the beginning of the Cracked Egg start. Strong roof moves out to a good horn, and then a long featureless stretch up to a small slopey edge. Move right a bit and mantle.Had to clean it up a ton and broke a hold off first go, but it's been sitting there so long that I have to imagine that it's been climbed before. If you have an earlier ascent, please reach out.
content.protection: 3+ Pads. Downhill slope and drop off can make for some sketchy falls, feel it out.
content.location: Middle junction, the intersection between the main trail and slab wall.

content.description: Start on a horizontal rail. Swing you some heel hooks and work your way up crimpers to the top
content.location: Right face of The Cracked Egg boulder

content.description:
Climb the obvious overhanging crack that splits the middle of the boulder. There are two solid under cling partial jams before the lip that allow it to go in the 5.12 range which seems about on par for V5. The real trick is getting your feet in the correct spot. Can seem hard if your crack technique isn't up to par

 Miscalled Roof Crack for a number of years
content.location: Smack dab in the middle of the main trail at the junction between the Main Wall and the Brick Wall

content.description: Right on the main trail between the Main Wall and the Brick Wall
